usefulItems: parchment paper, airtight container, rolling pin, wire rack, baking sheets (approx. 16 in. x 14 in.), cookie cutter (2 in.), oven
title: Honey and Oat Grahams

ingredients.content: 3 ½ oz whole wheat flour, plus extra to dust
2 ½ oz unsalted butter, in pieces and frozen

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 400°F and line two baking sheets (approx. 16 in. x 14 in.) with parchment.
Place flour, oats, sugar, salt and baking soda into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add lemon juice, milk and honey and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Tip dough out and bring together. On a generously floured work surface, roll out dough to ¼ in. thickness. Cut out dough with a round cookie cutter (2 in.) and place on prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 12-15 minutes (400°F) until golden. Allow to rest on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve or store in an airtight container for 3-5 days.

hintsAndTricks: For a sweet version add icing. Use 1 tbsp lemon juice, 7 oz confectioners sugar and 1 oz water. Place all ingredients into mixing bowl and mix <b>15 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Use an icing spatula to cover each cookie. Allow to dry on a cooling rack.
Spread cookies with Nutella, peanut butter, jelly, or sliced banana.
